Package CashProgram

Class HW2_kennamer

java.lang.Object
CashProgram.HW2_kennamer
public class HW2_kennamer extends Object
The main class of the program, represents a cash register that sells individual items

      formatting - the string formating of that question
      Returns:

    • askFile

      public static File askFile(String question, String angry_question, String formatting)
      demands a valid file input from the user
      Parameters:
      question - the question to display to the user
      angry_question - the question to display after a file path which does not exist is passed
      formatting - the formating to use when displaying that question
      Returns:
      a file object pointing to an existing file and opened

    • askFile

      public static File askFile(String question, String angry_question)
      demands a valid file input from the user, enables optional variables
      Parameters:
      question - the question to display to the user
      angry_question - the question to display after a file path which does not exist is passed
      Returns:
      a file object pointing to an existing file and opened

    • ask

      public static String ask(String question)
      gets a string response from the user the idea here is that we can put our formating in one place and not have to change it everywhere in the program
      Parameters:
      question - the question to display to the user
      Returns:
      the string that the user typed

    • askDouble

      public static double askDouble(String question, String angry_question)
      demands a valid double input from the user
      Parameters:
      question - the question to ask the user
      angry_question - the angry question to ask the user when they give us an invalid double
      Returns:
      a valid double typed by the user

      public static int askInt(String question, String angry_question)
      demands a valid integer input from the user

    • askProductCode

      public static String askProductCode(ItemCounterContainer icc)
      asks the user for a product code
      Parameters:
      icc - item counter container, used to determine what product codes are valid
      Returns:
      valid product code, or -1 indicating a terminating response

    • productCodeCommand

      public static String productCodeCommand(ProductCatalog pc)
      asks the user for a product code, throws an exception if an invalid product code is given we could probably make this better in the future by making the askItemCode accept a white list of valid values in an array, but this quick and dirty solution works atm
      Parameters:
      pc - item container to test against
      Returns:
      valid product code, or -1 indicating a terminating response

    • printSeperator

      public static void printSeperator()
      displays a separator on standard out

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      the main entry point of the program, reads in a series of sales items from the disk queries the user to see what purchases they are making computes change and records total sales for the day
      Parameters:
      args - command line arguments inputted to the program
